meanings.definition: Having the power to hear sounds said to exist beyond the reach of ordinary experience or capacity.
meanings.sent1: The clairaudient child claimed to hear whispers from the stars.
meanings.sent2: She believed in the clairaudient abilities of her favorite superhero.
meanings.sent3: The clairaudient cat seemed to listen to the wind's secrets with great interest.
meanings.sent4: His clairaudient mind picked up on the unspoken emotions in the room.
meanings.sent5: The clairaudient tree seemed to hum a mysterious tune in the moonlight.

meanings.definition: A person who is said to have the power to hear sounds said to exist beyond the reach of ordinary experience or capacity.
meanings.sent1: The clairaudient claimed to hear the whispers of ancient spirits.
meanings.sent2: People sought advice from the clairaudient to connect with lost loved ones.
meanings.sent3: The clairaudient at the party could hear the thoughts of the shy guests.
meanings.sent4: She was known as the clairaudient of the town, always hearing things others couldn't.
meanings.sent5: The clairaudient was like a bridge between the living and the unseen world.
